p: Several solutions of the extracts of O. fieldingiana were prepared in the following concentrations: 250, 125, 25, 12.5, 1.25, 0.25, 0.125, and 0.025 μg/mL. The negative control was a DPPH methanol solution and the positive control was prepared by mixing a standard (quercetin) and DPPH. Methanol solutions of the extracts (100 μL) were mixed with 3.9 mL of a DPPH solution; then the solutions were stored in the dark for 60 minutes and the reading was performed by spectrophotometer at the wavelength of 515 nm [ 18, 20]. The DPPH free radical inhibition was calculated by the scavenging index (SI 50) = (Abs DPPH – Abs Sample) x 100 / Abs Sample.
